channel.title: Money Managers News
channel.description: Money Managers delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest financial stories from the United States and across the world.

item.title: TR Financial Woes
item.description: Taylor Robotics is "tapped out" and can't borrow any more money to cover its mounting losses, making deep pay and benefit cuts it is seeking from its employees essential to its survival, the company's chief financial officer told an arbitration panel Tuesday.
item.dc:subject: Industries

item.title: NASDAQ Rallies
item.description: U.S. stocks rallied on Tuesday, sending both the Dow Industrials and the broader SP 500 indexes close to five-year highs as a drop in Treasury yields eased worries about the interest rate and Goldman Sachs Group Inc. posted a record profit.
item.dc:subject: Markets

item.title: Gold Jumps
item.description: Gold jumped to a one-month high at the close on Tuesday, powered by speculative and consumer buying and also by the dollar's steep fall, traders and analysts said.
item.dc:subject: Markets

item.title: Possible WTO Sanctions
item.description: The European Union advised the World Trade Organization on Tuesday that it would reintroduce trade sanctions against Japan in two months unless the country complies with a WTO ruling against tax breaks for Japanese companies operating overseas.
item.dc:subject: International
